main event: An unidentified bright object, similar to a meteor, was observed hovering and maneuvering in the sky southeast of Louisville, Kentucky on November 8, 1960.
interesting points: The object moved at low speed and did not have a trail or make any sound.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes.
The observer concluded the object was possibly an aircraft, but could not definitively identify it.
The sighting was added to the Project Blue Book file to complete the record, even though the time of the observation was listed as 2400Z.
The report mentions a case number (CF 301352) and references Project 10079, indicating this was part of a classified government investigation into unidentified aerial phenomena.
sighted object: a bright object, like a meteor, that hovered and maneuvered
location: Approximately 40 miles southeast of Louisville, Kentucky
